title: ISPT retail fund delivers 3.3pc as sector suffers
text:
The $1.7 billion ISPT Retail Australia Property Trust has delivered a 3.3 per cent total return in the past year as its neighbourhood and sub-regional centres are buffeted by headwinds in the sector.

By contrast, a year earlier the 38-asset fund generated a 13.3 per cent return for its investors, the group of industry funds on whose behalf ISPT invests.

The financial year 2019 returns show a 6.06 per cent income return for the retail fund dragged back by a negative 2.42 per cent return on capital values. Over the past five years, the fund has returned an annualised return of 11.54 per cent.

"The portfolio value reflected a market environment of selective softening market rents, rising incentives and some impetus to softening yields," the trust's annual report said.

The return figure will add to concerns about shopping mall values as the sector battles with both softness in consumer sentiment and the structural threat posed by e-commerce.

In another wake-up call for retail landlords, fund manager AMP Capital wrote down its acquisition in a major Brisbane mall, the Indooroopilly shopping centre, by more than 10 per cent, it was revealed in July.
description: The return figures will add to concerns about shopping mall values as the sector battles with both softness in consumer sentiment and the structural threat posed by e-commerce.
